title: How to Text a Colombian Girl: Flirty Phrases and Tips

steps.title: Steer clear of mixed signals when you’re texting a Colombian girl.
steps.content: Steer clear of mixed signals when you’re texting a Colombian girl. Be clear about your intentions by telling her you like her. You can let her know you’re into her by sending sweet messages and being attentive and assertive. Being open about your feelings makes you come off as courageous, so don’t be afraid to make your move. [1] X Research source “I can’t lie, you’re gorgeous.” “What I wouldn’t give to be by your side right now.” “I’m totally into you.”

steps.title: Colombian culture respects strangers and family alike, so return the favor.
steps.content: Colombian culture respects strangers and family alike, so return the favor. The last thing you want to do is disrespect her, so keep your texts polite and reasonable even when you’re flirting. In other words, don’t type anything you wouldn’t say to her in person. “I’m enjoying every moment I have with you 🥰” “How did your meeting go today?” “It sounds like you had a rough day. 😢 Is there anything I can do to make it better?”

steps.title: Colombian or not, most girls love an occasional flattering comment.
steps.content: Colombian or not, most girls love an occasional flattering comment. You know she’s beautiful inside and out, so don’t be afraid to tell her so! She’ll appreciate the sweet gesture and may even give you a cheesy compliment in return. [2] X Research source “You have nothing to worry about! You’re the smartest person I know!” “When I think of your smile, my day is instantly better 😉” “I love your new profile pic! The new hair really suits you!”

steps.title: Like all of us, Colombians love a little bit of flirting.
steps.content: Like all of us, Colombians love a little bit of flirting. Don’t be afraid of making a move sooner rather than later, so drop some not-so-subtle hints to grab her attention. There’s no problem with getting a little dirty, but remember to keep the flirts respectful. [3] X Research source “Could you stop being amazing? You’re driving me so crazy.” “Just saw the pic you posted…Looking hotter than ever 😍” “How is the most beautiful woman on earth doing this morning?”

steps.title: Make her laugh with some sarcastic and self-deprecating jokes.
steps.content: Make her laugh with some sarcastic and self-deprecating jokes. Humor is a key part of Colombian culture, so show her your funny side with a joke or two. This is a great way to lighten the mood and get her to smile while texting you. [4] X Research source “I hate when I’m about to hug someone sexy and my face hits a mirror…🤣” “My job is secure. No one else wants it.” “If I had a dollar for every girl that found me unattractive, they would eventually find me attractive! 🙃”

steps.title: Music is a big part of Colombian culture.
steps.content: Music is a big part of Colombian culture. Ask her what type of music she likes, and tell her about your favorite bands. You may have different tastes based on where you’re from, but that’s okay! Make each other playlists with your favorite songs to learn more about each other’s cultures. [5] X Research source “What type of music do you like to listen to?” “Don’t laugh, but I’m a big fan of country 🤠 What music do you listen to in Colombia?” “Are there any Colombian artists you would recommend? I’d love to hear the music you listen to.”

steps.title: Many Colombians easily open up about their emotions.
steps.content: Many Colombians easily open up about their emotions. Don’t be afraid to ask questions to get to know her—this is the only way to develop a real relationship. In the beginning, stick to topics like her interests, music taste, and general personality. As you start to get to know each other better, branch out! [6] X Research source “What do you like to do in your free time?” “Who’s your favorite musician? I have no shame in saying I really like Taylor Swift 😂” “How would you describe yourself in 3 words?”

steps.title: In Colombian culture, a person’s family is a big part of their identity.
steps.content: In Colombian culture, a person’s family is a big part of their identity. To her, everyone she’s close to may be considered family—from her neighbor to the person who owns her favorite store. Family is community, so take the time to learn about everyone she loves. [7] X Research source “Tell me a little about your family.” “What’s your family like? Do you have any siblings?” “I only have a handful of cousins. What about you?”

steps.title: Colombia is an energetic place, but many Colombians are good listeners too.
steps.content: Colombia is an energetic place, but many Colombians are good listeners too. She will most likely want to learn just as much about you as you want to learn about her, so tell her about yourself. Keep things on a positive note to start, and as you text each other more, share deeper parts of yourself. [8] X Research source “I have this weird habit of eating apple cores. Still surprised an apple tree hasn’t grown inside me. 😂” “I really like knitting. It takes my mind off things. What about you? Any grandma-ish hobbies?” “I’m one of six siblings. It can be a madhouse over here! 😅 Do you have any siblings?”

steps.title: Colombian Spanish is a musical language full of quirks and slang.
steps.content: Colombian Spanish is a musical language full of quirks and slang. Take the time to learn some of the phrases she’s most likely to use so you can communicate better. Going the extra mile to text her in her native language can show her you’re willing to learn more about her culture. [9] X Research source Instead of asking her “How are you?” with “¿Cómo estás?”, ask “What’s up?” like a local with “¿Qué más?” or “¿Quiubo?” Describe “cool” stuff as “bacano” or “chévere.” If Spanish isn’t your first language, no worries! Google Translate can help you bridge the language gap. Plus, converting your native language into hers can help you learn even faster.

steps.title: A Colombian girl’s faith might be a big part of her identity.
steps.content: A Colombian girl’s faith might be a big part of her identity. Although there isn’t an official religion in Colombia, over 90% of Colombians are Christian. Because of this, religion is influential in many Colombians’ daily life. She may go to church every week, or participate in bible studies. Listen when she talks about religion, even if you don’t necessarily agree, to show her you care. [10] X Research source “How was church last night?” “I’ve never thought of it like that. You’re making me question everything 😂” “I can’t say I’m very religious, but I want to learn more about your faith.”

steps.title: A Colombian girl will appreciate you being respectful of her schedule.
steps.content: A Colombian girl will appreciate you being respectful of her schedule. Before you text her, consider the time and what she may be doing. There may be a time difference if she’s currently living in Colombia. Find out what time it is near her, and text her when she’s free, even if that means texting her when it’s super late by you. This attention is sure to be noticed. “Hey! When does school start and end for you?” “Can’t believe you just woke up and it’s nearly midnight here. One day, we’ll wake up together 😉” “When’s the best time for us to chat? Don’t want to be blowing up your phone during a meeting! 😂”

steps.title: There are many misinterpretations of Colombian culture.
steps.content: There are many misinterpretations of Colombian culture. When you text a Colombian girl, avoid mentioning any stereotypes or making insensitive comments. Each Colombian girl is different, so get to know her rather than the stereotype of her culture seen on TV. Here are some topics to avoid: [11] X Research source Jokes about drugs, drug consumption, or drug cartels. Violence in Colombia. Colombia struggles today and throughout history.
